definitions.definition: to (cause someone to) be in a position in which the lower part of the body is resting on a seat or other type of support, with the upper part of the body vertical:
to be a model for a painter, photographer, etc.:
examples: Monet's wife sat for him many times.

definitions.definition: (of an animal such as a dog) to move into a position with its back legs bent and its tail end on the ground:
examples: We're trying to train our dog to sit.

definitions.definition: If a bird sits on its eggs, it covers them with its body to keep them warm before they hatch.
